channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-16183] Correct errors in example programs of coprocessor in Ref Guide
item.description: There are some errors in the example programs for coprocessor in Ref Guide. Such as using deprecated APIs, generic...
item.summary: Correct errors in example programs of coprocessor in Ref Guide

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Xiang Li Please add more details about the error and how to correct it, thanks.
Hi Yu, I updated the description. Sorry...
Temporarily assigned to myself to attach a patch according to the description

Attaching a patch applying most of the changes mentioned in description, except for removing the invocation of preGet(e, get, kvs); in preGetOp since the preGet CP hook is already removed, refer to HBASE-11919 for more details
Assign back to Xiang Li, please check the patch and do necessary supplement if needed. Thanks for pointing this out.

Yu Li Thanks for the review and the patch!
After reading HBASE-11919, I think the following part in preGetOp() in RegionObserverExample in section 90.1 can be all removed


List kvs = new ArrayList(results.size());

for (Cell c : results) {

  kvs.add(KeyValueUtil.ensureKeyValue(c));

}

preGet(e, get, kvs);

results.clear();

results.addAll(kvs);

Those logic is useful because originally kvs is List<KeyValue> (Please see the description of HBASE-11919). After HBASE-11919 is applied, those logic seem of no use.

Do you think so?
I also need to update the description of this JIRA, there are some errors, such as in item 1, I used the real hostname directly... Will make some updates after JIRA system is available

Yu Li, Jerry He
I made the patch ready based on master branch. How could I upload the patch? Something wrong with the JIRA system?
Ever tried "More->Attach Files"? Or any special problem?

No, there is no "Attach Files" under "More" now, maybe since last Friday. I have no idea why, because I can see that option and uploaded some patches before.

I am not sure if my ID is removed from the contributor list by mistake? Because I can not "assign to me" either.
Sounds weird but I've no idea how to check/fix this. Any idea Jerry He

Hi, Xiang Li
You were added to the contributor list previously. Did you change your jira id recently?
Jerry He, Yu Li, thanks for taking care of this! I changed to use a new computer so a wrong user is used. Sorry...

Patch v1 for mater branch fixes the following errors:

1. In Section 89.3.3
Change


String path = "hdfs://<namenode>:<port>/user/<hadoop-user>/coprocessor.jar";

into


Path path = new Path("hdfs://<namenode>:<port>/user/<hadoop-user>/coprocessor.jar");

Reason:
The second parameter of HTableDescriptor.addCoprocessor() is org.apache.hadoop.fs.Path, not String.
See http://hbase.apache.org/devapidocs/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/HTableDescriptor.html

2. In Section 89.3.3
Change


HBaseAdmin admin = new HBaseAdmin(conf);

into


Connection connection = ConnectionFactory.createConnection(conf);

Admin admin = connection.getAdmin();

Reason:
HBASE-12083 makes "new HBaseAdmin()" deprecated and the instance of Admin is supposed to get from Connection.getAdmin()
Also see http://hbase.apache.org/devapidocs/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/client/HBaseAdmin.html

3. In section 90.1
Change


public void preGetOp(final ObserverContext e, final Get get, final List results)

into


public void preGetOp(final ObserverContext<RegionCoprocessorEnvironment> e, final Get get, final List<Cell> results)

Change


public RegionScanner preScannerOpen(final ObserverContext e, final Scan scan,

into


public RegionScanner preScannerOpen(final ObserverContext<RegionCoprocessorEnvironment> e, final Scan scan，

Change


public boolean postScannerNext(final ObserverContext e, final InternalScanner s, final List results, final int limit, final boolean hasMore) throws IOException {

into


public boolean postScannerNext(final ObserverContext<RegionCoprocessorEnvironment> e, final InternalScanner s, final List<Result> results, final int limit, final boolean hasMore) throws IOException {

Change


Iterator iterator = results.iterator();

into


Iterator<Result> iterator = results.iterator();

Reason:
Generic

4. In section 90.1
Remove the following code


List kvs = new ArrayList(results.size());

for (Cell c : results) {

  kvs.add(KeyValueUtil.ensureKeyValue(c));

}

preGet(e, get, kvs);

results.clear();

results.addAll(kvs);

Reason:
They are of no use after HBASE-11871 is applied.

5. Section 90.1
change 


Cell c = CellUtil.createCell(get.getRow(),COLUMN _FAMILY, COLUMN,

            System.currentTimeMillis(), (byte)4, VALUE);

to


Cell c = CellUtil.createCell(get.getRow(),COLUMN_FAMILY, COLUMN,

            System.currentTimeMillis(), (byte)4, VALUE);

Reason
It is a typo, there is a whitespace between "COLUMN" and "_FAMILY"
Patch v1 for master branch.

Hi Jerry He, Yu Li, would you please review the patch v1 at your most convenience?
The only divergence could be that I proposed the following code could be all removed when overriding preGetOp() in class RegionObserverExample in section 90.1, due to HBASE-11871


List kvs = new ArrayList(results.size());

for (Cell c : results) {

  kvs.add(KeyValueUtil.ensureKeyValue(c));

}

preGet(e, get, kvs);

results.clear();

results.addAll(kvs);

to make it as


@Override

public void preGetOp(final ObserverContext<RegionCoprocessorEnvironment> e, final Get get, final List<Cell> results)

throws IOException {



  if (Bytes.equals(get.getRow(),ADMIN)) {

    Cell c = CellUtil.createCell(get.getRow(),COLUMN _FAMILY, COLUMN,

    System.currentTimeMillis(), (byte)4, VALUE);

    results.add(c);

    e.bypass();

  }

}

-1 overall

Hi Yu, do you mind help me to commit this at your most convenience?

This patch does not adhere to the HBase patch guidelines. Please re-create the patch using git format-patch as outlined in http://hbase.apache.org/book.html#committing.patches. This makes it much easier for a committer to apply the patch and give you credit for your work.
Please re-create and re-attach the patch.
Please reformat the patch following Misty Stanley-Jones's comments, and we need at least another committer's +1 to commit this. Thanks.

Misty Stanley-Jones, thanks for reviewing my patch and pointing those out! really appreciate it!
Patch v2 is generated by git format-patch and uploaded.

Would you please review it at your most convenience?
v2 lgtm and confirmed it could be applied by "git am" with a sign-off.
